title: Duality of Geometric Tests for Forward-Flatness
authors: Johannes Schrotshamer, Bernd Kolar, Markus Sch\"oberl
abstract:
Recently it has been shown that the property of forward-flatness for
discrete-time systems, which is a generalization of static feedback
linearizability and a special case of a more general concept of flatness, can
be checked by two different geometric tests. One is based on unique sequences
of involutive distributions, while the other is based on a unique sequence of
integrable codistributions. In this paper, the relation between these sequences
is discussed and it is shown that the tests are in fact dual. The presented
results are illustrated by an academic example.
